metadata.title: CVE-2015-7183 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the PL_ARENA_ALLOCATE implementation in NetscapePortable Runtime (NSPR) in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before3.19.2.1 and 3.20.x before 3.20.1, as used in Firefox before 42.0 andFirefox ESR 38.x before 38.4 and other products, allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption andapplication crash) via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnspr4 - 2:4.10.10-1ubuntu1
libnspr4-0d - 2:4.10.10-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

firefox - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

virtualbox - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-qt - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nspr package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.10.10-1ubuntu1').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '42.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.4.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
virtualbox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.14-dfsg-1').
